metadata.title: CVE-2024-35972 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:bnxt_en: Fix possible memory leak in bnxt_rdma_aux_device_init() If ulp =kzalloc() fails, the allocated edev will leak because it is not properlyassigned and the cleanup path will not be able to free it. Fix it byassigning it properly immediately after allocation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-35972` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1098.105').
